Mix well.', 'In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked pork, rice noodles, spring onions, and carrots. Pour the dressing over the top and toss until everything is evenly coated.', 'Serve the noodle salad garnished with additional mint and coriander leaves. Enjoy this refreshing and zesty dish!']

recipe_name: Mustard-Infused Sausage and Apple Bites with Savory Pancake
ingredients: ['Sunflower oil', 'Reduced fat sausages', 'Plain flour', 'Skimmed milk', 'Wholegrain mustard', 'Egg', 'Apple', 'Salt', 'Sugar (optional)', 'Basic spices (such as black pepper)']
steps: ['Begin by preheating your skillet over medium heat.', 'Slice the reduced fat sausages into bite-sized pieces and add them to the skillet with a tablespoon of sunflower oil. Brown the sausages until they are fully cooked. Once done, remove from the skillet and set aside.', 'In the same skillet, add thin slices of apple. Cook until they are slightly soft and have a golden color. Set them aside with the sausages.', 'In a mixing bowl, crack the egg and add a pinch of salt. Whisk until the egg is fully beaten.', 'Gradually incorporate half a cup of plain flour and around a cup of skimmed milk into the egg mixture. Continue to whisk until the batter is smooth.', 'Stir a teaspoon of wholegrain mustard into the pancake batter for added flavor, and add a pinch of black pepper according to your taste.', 'Heat a teaspoon of sunflower oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.', 'Pour a small amount of the pancake batter into the pan, tilting the pan to spread the batter thinly and evenly. Cook the pancake until bubbles form on the surface, then flip it and cook the other side until golden brown.', 'Place the cooked pancakes on a plate, add the sausage and apple slices on top, and optionally drizzle a small amount of wholegrain mustard over the top for extra flavor.', 'Serve the mustard-infused sausage and apple bites while warm, and enjoy!']

recipe_name: Blackberry and Apple Cloud Cake
ingredients: ['150g butter, softened', '200g golden caster sugar', '3 eggs', '1 egg white', '200g plain flour', "1 tsp baking powder (assume part of 'some basic spices')", '1/4 tsp salt (assumed to be available)', '100ml full-fat milk', '2 apples, peeled and thinly sliced', '150g blackberries', '1 tbsp sunflower oil (for greasing)']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 180°C (160°C fan-assisted) or Gas Mark 4 and grease a 23cm round cake tin with sunflower oil.', 'In a large mixing bowl, cream together 150g softened butter and 200g golden caster sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Beat in the 3 whole eggs, one at a time, ensuring each is well incorporated before adding the next.', 'In a separate bowl, whisk 1 egg white until stiff peaks form.', 'Sift 200g plain flour into the butter and sugar mixture, and add 1 tsp of baking powder and 1/4 tsp of salt. Fold gently to combine.', 'Gradually stir in 100ml of full-fat milk to the batter until the mixture is smooth.', 'Fold in the whisked egg white gently with a spatula to keep the air in the mixture.', 'Pour half of the batter into the prepared cake tin.', 'Layer the thinly sliced apples and blackberries on top of the batter in the tin.', 'Cover the fruit layer with the remaining batter, smoothing the top with a spatula.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.', 'Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.', 'Serve the Blackberry and Apple Cloud Cake as is, or with a dusting of golden caster sugar on top.']

recipe_name: Creamy Curried Salmon with Spicy Roasted Potatoes
ingredients: ['potato', 'curry paste', 'Greek yogurt', 'salmon fillets', 'butter', 'dried chilli flakes', 'milk', 'coriander leaves', 'tomatoes', 'salt', 'oil']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).', 'Wash the potatoes and cut them into chunks. Toss with oil, salt, and dried chilli flakes until evenly coated. Spread the potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until crispy and golden.', 'While the potatoes are roasting, season the salmon fillets with salt. Heat a pan over medium-high heat, add a bit of oil, and sear the salmon on each side for about 3-4 minutes or until cooked to your liking.', 'For the curry sauce, combine Greek yogurt, curry paste, and a splash of milk in a bowl to create a creamy sauce. Adjust the seasoning with salt, if necessary.', 'In the same pan used for the salmon, reduce the heat to low and add the curry sauce, gently warming it through but not boiling.', 'Once the sauce is warm, return the salmon fillets to the pan, spooning sauce over them to coat well.', 'Chop the tomatoes and coriander leaves finely, and stir into the sauce to incorporate, heating for an additional minute or two.', 'Serve the curried salmon with a dollop of the sauce on top, surrounded by the spicy roasted potatoes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.']

recipe_name: Herb-Infused Beetroot & Potato Salad with Horseradish Cream Dressing
ingredients: ['soured cream', 'Greek yogurt', 'creamed horseradish', 'potatoes', 'chives', 'ham', 'herb salad', 'cooked beetroot', 'salt', 'pepper', 'olive oil']
steps: ['Begin by washing and boiling the potatoes until they are cooked through but still firm. Once done, allow them to cool and then chop them into bite-sized pieces.', 'While the potatoes are cooling, chop the cooked beetroot into similar bite-sized pieces.', 'Cut the ham into strips or cube it, depending on your preference.', 'Finely chop the chives and set aside a few for garnishing later on.', 'In a bowl, mix the soured cream, Greek yogurt, and creamed horseradish together. Add salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil to taste, creating a smooth and spicy horseradish cream dressing.', 'In a large salad bowl, gently toss the chopped potatoes, beetroot, and ham together.', 'Add the herb salad mix to the bowl. You may choose to leave larger leaves whole for a rustic look or chop them for a more uniform appearance.', 'Drizzle the horseradish cream dressing over the salad and toss everything together ensuring all ingredients are well coated.', 'Garnish with the reserved chives, adjusting seasoning with salt and pepper if necessary.', 'Serve the Herb-Infused Beetroot & Potato Salad with Horseradish Cream Dressing as an appetizing starter or as a refreshing side dish to a main course.']

recipe_name: Spicy Oriental Prawn Noodle Stir-Fry
ingredients: ['dried rice vermicelli', 'Straight to Wok rice noodles', 'sunflower oil', 'ginger', 'hot curry powder', 'Chinese cabbage', 'carrot', 'chicken stock', 'brown sugar', 'vinegar', 'prawns', 'beansprouts', 'spring onions', 'Oriental chilli oil', 'shrimp paste', 'soy sauce', 'salt', 'sugar']
steps: ['Soak the dried rice vermicelli in hot water for 10 minutes, then drain and set aside.', 'Julienne the ginger and cut the Chinese cabbage and carrot into thin strips. Slice the spring onions.', 'Heat sunflower oil in a large wok over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp paste, a teaspoon of ginger, and a tablespoon of hot curry powder, frying for 30 seconds until aromatic.', 'Turn the heat up to high, add prawns to the wok, and stir-fry until they start to turn pink.', 'Add the Chinese cabbage, and carrot, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.', 'Pour in a splash of vinegar and a half cup of chicken stock along with a tablespoon of brown sugar and two tablespoons of soy sauce to create the sauce. Stir well to combine.', 'Add the soaked and drained rice vermicelli along with the Straight to Wok rice noodles to the wok, ensuring they separate and soak up the sauce.', 'Stir in beansprouts and cook for another minute.', 'Season the stir-fry with a bit of salt and sugar to taste. Drizzle with Oriental chilli oil for extra heat.', 'Garnish with the spring onions and serve hot, offering additional soy sauce and chilli oil on the side for those who desire an extra kick.']

recipe_name: Sherry-Spiced Fruit Loaf with Vanilla Custard
ingredients: ['1 cup mixed dried fruit', '1/2 cup raisins', '1/2 cup currants', '1/2 cup sultanas', '1/2 cup sherry', '3/4 cup butter, softened', '1 cup caster sugar', '4 eggs', '2 cups self-raising flour', '1 tsp baking powder', '2 tsp mixed spice', 'Zest of 1 orange', 'Zest of 2 clementines', '2 tbsp sloe gin', '1/2 cup apricot jam', '1 cup vanilla custard']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 170°C (340°F). Grease and line a loaf tin with baking paper.', 'In a large bowl, soak the mixed dried fruit, raisins, currants, and sultanas in sherry for at least 2 hours, or overnight if time allows.', 'In a separate mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and caster sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Beat the eggs in one at a time, ensuring each is well incorporated before adding the next.', 'Fold in the self-raising flour, baking powder, and mixed spice into the butter mixture. Mix until just combined to avoid overmixing.', 'Stir in the orange zest, clementine zest, and sloe gin. Add the sherry-soaked fruit mixture and any remaining liquid. Combine gently but thoroughly.', 'Pour the cake batter into the prepared loaf tin and smooth the top with a spatula.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 60-70 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.', 'Ten minutes before removing the cake from the oven, gently heat the apricot jam in a small saucepan until it becomes runny.', 'Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and while still hot, brush the top with the warmed apricot jam to create a glossy, sticky finish.', 'Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 15 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.', 'Serve slices of the fruit loaf with a generous helping of vanilla custard. The custard can be served warm or cold, as preferred.']

recipe_name: Sage-Infused Sausage Puff Twists
ingredients: ['puff pastry', 'pork sausages', 'sage', 'egg']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).', "On a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry sheet until it's slightly thinner and larger in size.", 'Remove the casing from the pork sausages and mix the sausage meat with chopped fresh sage. If you like, you can add a pinch of salt and some cracked black pepper to taste.', 'Form the sausage meat into a log shape that is slightly shorter in length than the puff pastry width.', 'Place the seasoned sausage meat along the center of the puff pastry sheet.', 'Cut the puff pastry along both sides of the sausage meat into strips about 1 inch wide. You will now have a series of horizontal strips along the sausage meat.', 'Starting from the top, twist each strip of puff pastry over the sausage meat, creating a twist effect. Continue this for all the strips, alternating left and right to create a braid-like appearance.', 'Beat an egg in a small bowl to create an egg wash.', 'Brush the beaten egg over the twisted puff pastry to give it a golden sheen once baked.', 'Carefully transfer the assembled sage-infused sausage puff twist onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the sausage meat is fully cooked.', 'Let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.']

recipe_name: Summer Fruit Vanilla Cake
ingredients: ['2 cups frozen mixed summer fruits', '1 cup caster sugar, plus extra for sprinkling', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3/4 cup full-fat milk', '2 large eggs', '1/2 cup sunflower oil', '2 cups plain flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', 'Pinch of salt']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease and line a 9-inch round cake tin with baking paper.', 'In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and 1 cup of caster sugar together until pale and slightly thickened.', 'Slowly add the sunflower oil and the vanilla extract to the egg mixture, whilst continuing to beat.', 'In a separate bowl, sift together the plain flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.', 'Alternately fold the dry ingredients and the milk into the egg mixture, starting and ending with the flour mixture.', 'Gently fold in the frozen mixed summer fruits until they are just incorporated, being careful not to overmix and break up the fruits too much.', 'Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin, smoothing the top with a spatula.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.', 'Once baked, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the tin for 10 minutes.', 'Transfer the cake to a wire rack to cool completely.', 'Sprinkle the top of the cake with a little extra caster sugar for a sweet, crunchy topping before serving.']

recipe_name: Classic Mimosa
ingredients: ['champagne or prosecco', 'orange juice']
steps: ['Chill the champagne or prosecco and orange juice beforehand.', 'Pour the chilled champagne or prosecco into a flute glass until it is half full.', 'Top up the glass with chilled orange juice.', 'Stir gently to mix the two liquids, being careful not to over-stir and lose the effervescence of the champagne or prosecco.', 'Serve immediately and enjoy.']

recipe_name: Mediterranean Prawn and Fennel Sauté
ingredients: ['olive oil', 'red onion', 'fennel bulb', 'cherry tomatoes', 'prawns', 'olives', 'salt', 'basic spices']
steps: ['Begin by prepping your ingredients: thinly slice the red onion, slice the fennel bulb into thin strips, halve the cherry tomatoes, pit and slice the olives if not already pitted and sliced, and clean the prawns (if not already done).', 'Heat a generous amount of olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat.', 'Add the sliced red onion and fennel bulb to the pan, and cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and fragrant, stirring occasionally.', 'Stir in the cherry tomatoes and olives, cooking for another 3-4 minutes until the tomatoes start to soften and release their juice.', 'Season the prawns with salt and a pinch of your preferred basic spices (such as black pepper, paprika, or chili flakes for some heat).', 'Push the vegetables to one side of the pan, and add the prawns to the empty side, allowing them to cook for about 2 minutes on each side or until they turn pink and opaque.', 'Give everything a good stir to combine the flavors, and adjust the seasoning if needed.', 'Once everything is cooked through, remove the pan from the heat.', 'Serve your Mediterranean Prawn and Fennel Sauté hot, straight from the pan, for a flavorful and healthy meal.']

recipe_name: Hearty English Beef Stew with Horseradish Dumplings
ingredients: ['600g beef shin, cut into chunks', '400g beef neck, cut into chunks', '300g stewing steak, cut into chunks', '3 tablespoons plain flour', '2 tablespoons dripping or lard', '1 tablespoon oil', '8 shallots, peeled and left whole', '500ml beef stock', '150g suet', '1 tablespoon fresh grated horseradish', '200g self-raising flour', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
steps: ['Step 1: Preheat your oven to 160°C (320°F). In a large bowl, mix the plain flour with a generous pinch of salt and pepper. Coat the beef shin, neck, and stewing steak pieces in the seasoned flour.', 'Step 2: Heat the dripping or lard along with the oil in a large casserole dish over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches until all sides are caramelized, then set aside.', 'Step 3: In the same casserole dish, add the whole shallots and cook until they begin to soften and turn translucent, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the shallots and set them aside with the beef.', 'Step 4: Pour in the beef stock to deglaze the pan, scraping up any brown bits from the bottom. Return the beef and shallots to the pan. Bring to a simmer.', 'Step 5: Cover the casserole dish and transfer it to the preheated oven. Let it cook for 2-3 hours, or until the meat is tender.', 'Step 6: While the stew is cooking, make the dumplings. In a bowl, mix together the suet, self-raising flour, fresh grated horseradish, a pinch of salt, and enough cold water to form a sticky dough. Roll into small balls.', 'Step 7: About 30 minutes before the stew is done, remove the casserole dish from the oven and carefully place the dumplings on top of the stew. Make sure they are spaced apart.', 'Step 8: Return the uncovered casserole dish to the oven and cook for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the dumplings are golden brown and puffed up.', 'Step 9: Remove the casserole dish from the oven. Check the seasoning of the stew and adjust with salt and pepper if necessary.', 'Step 10: Serve the hearty stew with the horseradish dumplings on top, making sure everyone gets a taste of the tender beef, soft shallots, and flavorful, fluffy dumplings.']

recipe_name: Spicy Beef Meatballs with Tomato Chilli Sauce
ingredients: ['500g lean minced beef', '1 cup white breadcrumbs', '3 spring onions, finely chopped', '2 garlic cloves, minced', '1 large egg', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon Tabasco sauce, or to taste', '1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves', '200g cherry tomatoes, halved', '2 tablespoons chilli sauce', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', 'Salt to taste']
steps: ['In a large mixing bowl, combine the minced beef, breadcrumbs, spring onions, minced garlic, egg, ground cumin, Tabasco sauce, coriander leaves, and a pinch of salt. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly distributed.', 'Shape the beef mixture into evenly sized meatballs, using about 2 tablespoons of mixture per meatball.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the meatballs. Cook them in batches if necessary, to avoid overcrowding the pan. Brown the meatballs on all sides, which should take about 5-7 minutes. Once browned, remove them from the pan and set aside.', 'In the same frying pan, reduce the heat to medium-low and add the cherry tomatoes. Cook for a couple of minutes until the tomatoes start to soften.', 'Add the chilli sauce to the tomatoes and stir to combine. Allow the sauce to simmer for a further 2-3 minutes, or until it thickens slightly.', 'Return the meatballs to the pan with the tomato chilli sauce, and toss gently to coat. Continue to cook for about 10 minutes, or until the meatballs are fully cooked through.', 'Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning with salt and more Tabasco sauce if you prefer a spicier taste.', 'Serve the spicy beef meatballs warm, garnished with additional chopped coriander if desired.']

recipe_name: Tropical Coconut Raspberry Custard Tarts
ingredients: ['Butter', 'Unsweetened desiccated coconut', 'Golden caster sugar', 'Self-raising flour', 'Baking powder', 'Eggs', 'Milk', 'Coconut cream', 'Cornflour', 'Icing sugar', 'Good-quality ready-made custard', 'Malibu (coconut-flavored rum)', 'Lime (zest and juice)', 'Frozen raspberries', 'Raspberry jam', 'Double cream', 'Fresh coconut (shaved for garnish)']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease tart tins with butter.', 'Prepare the tart crust by mixing 150g butter, 1 cup of self-raising flour, 1/2 cup of desiccated coconut, 1/3 cup of golden caster sugar, a pinch of salt, and 1 small beaten egg. Combine to form a dough and press into the tart tins. Refrigerate for 15 minutes.', 'Blind bake the tart crusts for 10-15 minutes until lightly golden. Remove from oven and allow to cool.', 'In a mixing bowl, stir together 2 cups of ready-made custard and 2 tablespoons of Malibu for a coconut twist. Add lime zest to taste.', 'In a small saucepan, mix the cornflour with a little milk to form a paste. Add 200ml of coconut cream and 2 tablespoons of icing sugar, heat gently, and whisk until thickened. Then fold this mixture into the custard and Malibu mixture.', 'Spoon the custard mixture into the cooled tart shells and place in the fridge to set for 1 hour.', 'Meanwhile, whip double cream with 1 tablespoon of icing sugar until it forms soft peaks. Fold in 1 tablespoon of lime juice for a hint of citrus.', 'In a separate saucepan, heat the raspberry jam until it is runny. Add the frozen raspberries and cook for 2-3 minutes until the raspberries are just softened.', 'To assemble the tarts, spoon a layer of the raspberry mixture over the set custard.', 'Pipe or dollop the whipped lime cream on top of the raspberry layer. Garnish with shaved fresh coconut and a drizzle of any remaining raspberry mixture.', 'Chill in the fridge for another 30 minutes before serving to allow the layers to set together.']

recipe_name: Tropical Pineapple-Lime Sundae
ingredients: ['caster sugar', 'vanilla paste', 'lime', 'pineapple', 'vanilla ice cream', 'coconut ice cream', 'salt']
steps: ['Gather your ingredients: caster sugar, vanilla paste, lime, pineapple, vanilla ice cream, coconut ice cream, and a pinch of salt.', 'Prepare the caramelized pineapple: Cut the pineapple into small bite-sized chunks. In a non-stick pan, add 2 tablespoons of caster sugar and heat until the sugar melts and begins to caramelize. Add the pineapple chunks and a pinch of salt, and cook until golden and the juices have mostly evaporated. Remove from heat.', 'Make the lime syrup: Zest the lime and squeeze the juice into a small saucepan. Add 2 tablespoons of caster sugar to the lime juice and zest, and cook over a low heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens into a syrup. Set aside to cool.', 'Combine vanilla paste and ice cream: Soften vanilla ice cream slightly, and swirl in 1 teaspoon of vanilla paste to add an extra layer of vanilla flavor.', 'Build your sundae: In serving glasses or bowls, start with a layer of caramelized pineapple, add a scoop of vanilla ice cream, a scoop of coconut ice cream, and drizzle the lime syrup over the top.', 'Finish and serve: Optionally, you can garnish the sundae with a few thin slices of lime or some extra caramelized pineapple pieces. Serve immediately and enjoy your tropical dessert experience.']

recipe_name: Stout-Braised Beef Stew with Thyme and Mushrooms
ingredients: ['3 tbsp unsalted butter', '2 onions, chopped', '4 garlic cloves, minced', '1 kg stewing steak, cut into chunks', '500 ml beef stock', '3 tbsp plain flour', '250 ml stout', '4-5 thyme sprigs', '2 bay leaves', '2 tbsp light muscovado sugar', '1 tbsp red wine vinegar', '2 tbsp mushroom ketchup', '1 celery heart, chopped', '1 tsp Marmite', 'French bread, for serving']
steps: ['Melt 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.', 'Increase heat to medium-high and add the stewing steak chunks to the pot. Cook until the beef is browned on all sides.', 'Sprinkle the plain flour over the beef and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring to coat the beef evenly with flour.', 'Pour the stout into the pot to deglaze, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom with a wooden spoon.', 'Add the beef stock, thyme sprigs, bay leaves, light muscovado sugar, red wine vinegar, mushroom ketchup, and chopped celery heart to the pot.', 'Stir in the Marmite until it is dissolved. This will add a rich umami flavor to the stew.', 'Bring the stew to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the beef is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.', 'Remove the bay leaves and thyme sprigs. If the stew is too liquid, you can simmer it uncovered for the last 20-30 minutes to reduce and thicken the sauce.', 'Before serving, adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper, and swirl in the remaining tablespoon of unsalted butter for added richness.', 'Serve the stew hot with slices of crusty French bread on the side for dipping into the savory broth.']

recipe_name: Summer Fruits Vanilla Cake
ingredients: ['2 cups frozen mixed summer fruits', '1 cup caster sugar, plus extra for sprinkling', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup full-fat milk', '3 eggs', '½ cup sunflower oil', '2 cups plain flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', 'Pinch of salt']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease a 9-inch round cake pan or springform pan and line the bottom with parchment paper to prevent sticking.', 'In a large mixing bowl, beat together 3 eggs and 1 cup caster sugar until light and fluffy. This should take about 3-4 minutes with an electric mixer on medium-high speed.', 'Gradually mix in ½ cup sunflower oil and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract into the egg mixture, ensuring it’s well incorporated.', 'In another bowl, sift together 2 cups of plain flour, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, and a pinch of salt.', 'Alternate adding the dry ingredients and 1 cup of full-fat milk to the egg mixture, starting and ending with the dry ingredients. Stir just until everything is combined, being careful not to overmix.', 'If the frozen mixed summer fruits are large, chop them into smaller, bite-sized pieces. Gently fold the summer fruits into the batter, spreading them evenly.', 'Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, spreading it out evenly with a spatula. Sprinkle a little extra caster sugar over the top to create a sweet crust once baked.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean or with just a few moist crumbs attached.', 'Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing it. Then, let it cool completely on a wire rack.', 'Once cooled, you can dust with a bit more caster sugar if desired, and serve your Summer Fruits Vanilla Cake as a delightful dessert or afternoon treat.']

recipe_name: Classic Mimosa
ingredients: ['Champagne or Prosecco', 'Freshly squeezed orange juice', 'Sugar (optional)', 'A pinch of salt (optional)']
steps: ['Ensure both the Champagne or Prosecco and the freshly squeezed orange juice are well chilled.', 'If you like a sweeter drink, you can rim the champagne flutes with sugar. To do this, run an orange wedge around the rim of each glass and dip it into a small plate of sugar.', 'Pour the freshly squeezed orange juice into each flute, filling about one-third of the glass.', 'Slowly top off each glass with the Champagne or Prosecco, tilting the glass slightly and pouring gently to preserve the bubbles and prevent it from frothing over.', 'Optional: Add a pinch of salt to each glass to balance the sweetness.', 'Gently stir the mimosa with a spoon to mix the orange juice and champagne, if desired. Be careful not to stir too vigorously, as this will decrease the bubbles.', 'Serve the mimosas immediately to enjoy while the fizz is lively and strong.']

recipe_name: Mediterranean Prawn and Fennel Sauté
ingredients: ['olive oil', 'red onion', 'fennel bulb', 'cherry tomatoes', 'cooked, peeled prawns', 'black or green olives', 'salt', 'black pepper']
steps: ['Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.', 'Slice the red onion and fennel bulb thinly and add them to the pan. Sauté until the onion is translucent and the fennel is soft, about 5-6 minutes.', 'Halve the cherry tomatoes and add them to the pan. Cook until they soften and release their juices, about 3-4 minutes.', 'Toss in the cooked, peeled prawns and olives (sliced if preferred) to the pan. Stir to combine.', 'Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Cook until the prawns are heated through, about 2-3 minutes.', 'Remove the pan from heat. Allow the sauté to sit for a minute for the flavors to meld.', 'Serve warm as a light and flavorful Mediterranean dish.']

recipe_name: Tropical Coconut Lime Cake with Raspberry Filling
ingredients: ['200g butter, softened', '150g unsweetened desiccated coconut', '200g golden caster sugar', '250g self-raising flour', '1 tsp baking powder', '4 eggs', '100ml milk', '200ml coconut cream', '2 tbsp cornflour', '150g icing sugar', '300g good-quality ready-made custard', '50ml Malibu rum', 'Zest of 2 limes', 'Juice of 1 lime', '200g frozen raspberries, thawed', '4 tbsp raspberry jam', '250ml double cream', 'Fresh coconut shavings, for decoration']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 180C (160C fan-assisted). Grease and line two 20cm round cake tins.', 'In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and golden caster sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Beat in the eggs, one at a time, adding a spoonful of the flour with each to prevent curdling.', 'Fold in the remaining self-raising flour, baking powder, and desiccated coconut until well combined.', 'Gradually add the milk and Malibu rum, mixing until you have a smooth batter.', 'Divide the batter evenly between the prepared tins and smooth the tops.', 'Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes until golden and a skewer comes out clean.', 'While the cakes are baking, prepare the filling by mixing the thawed raspberries with the raspberry jam. In another bowl, whip the double cream until it forms soft peaks.', 'Once the cakes are done, allow them to cool in the tins for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.', 'For the lime icing, mix the icing sugar, coconut cream, lime zest, and lime juice together until smooth.', 'Mix the cornflour with a little water and stir into the custard, then cook over low heat until thickened. Allow it to cool.', 'To assemble the cake, place one cake layer on your serving platter. Spread the thickened custard over the first layer.', 'Top the custard with the raspberry filling, then carefully place the second cake layer on top.', 'Cover the top of the cake with the whipped cream, spreading it out gently.', 'Finally, drizzle the lime icing over the whipped cream and decorate with fresh coconut shavings.', 'Chill the cake in the fridge for at least an hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld and the icing to set slightly.', 'Serve and enjoy your Tropical Coconut Lime Cake with Raspberry Filling!']

recipe_name: Tropical Vanilla Pineapple Delight
ingredients: ['caster sugar', 'vanilla paste', 'lime juice', 'pineapple', 'vanilla ice cream', 'coconut ice cream']
steps: ['Cut the pineapple into small bite-sized chunks. Set aside a handful for garnish.', 'In a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of caster sugar with 1/4 cup of lime juice and heat until the sugar dissolves completely, creating a simple syrup.', 'Add the pineapple chunks to the saucepan and simmer for 5-10 minutes until the pineapple softens and infuses with the syrup.', 'Remove the pineapple mixture from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla paste.', 'Let the pineapple mixture cool to room temperature.', 'In serving glasses, layer scoops of vanilla ice cream and coconut ice cream alternately with the pineapple mixture.', 'Top each serving with a sprinkle of caster sugar and a few chunks of the reserved pineapple.', 'Drizzle a little bit of the leftover syrup from the saucepan over the ice creams for added flavor.']

recipe_name: Rustic Chestnut and Mushroom Stuffed Bacon Wraps
ingredients: ['1 large onion, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 cups small button mushrooms, quartered', '1 cup whole cooked chestnuts, crumbled', '200g Ardennes pâté', '1 tablespoon parsley, finely chopped', '1 teaspoon thyme leaves', '8 slices smoked streaky bacon', '1 cup oatmeal breadcrumbs', '2 eggs, beaten', 'Salt to taste', 'Pepper to taste']
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).', 'In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the chopped onions and cook until translucent.', 'Add the quartered mushrooms to the skillet and sauté until they are soft and have released their moisture.', 'Mix in the crumbled chestnuts and cook for another 2-3 minutes.', 'Stir in the Ardennes pâté, and cook until it is well combined with the mushroom and chestnut mixture.', 'Remove the skillet from heat and allow the mixture to cool slightly before adding the chopped parsley, thyme leaves, and oatmeal breadcrumbs. Mix well.', 'Season the stuffing mixture with salt and pepper to taste, then incorporate the beaten eggs to help bind the stuffing.', 'Lay out the bacon slices on a clean surface and divide the stuffing mixture evenly among them, placing a portion on one end of each bacon slice.', 'Roll the bacon slices tightly around the stuffing to create stuffed bacon wraps, ensuring that the ends are tucked in to prevent the stuffing from leaking out.', 'Place the bacon wraps seam-side down on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the stuffing is heated through.', 'Serve hot, garnished with extra chopped parsley if desired.']

recipe_name: Caramelized Brussels Sprouts with Pancetta and Chestnuts
ingredients: ['brussels sprouts', 'diced pancetta', 'cooked chestnuts', 'light muscovado sugar', 'vegetable stock', 'salt', 'pepper', 'olive oil']
steps: ['Wash the brussels sprouts and trim off the bottoms. Cut them in halves.', 'Heat a large pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of olive oil.', 'Once the oil is hot, add the diced pancetta to the pan and cook until it starts to crisp up.', 'Add the brussels sprouts to the pan with the pancetta and cook for around 5 minutes, or until the sprouts start to brown on the cut sides.', 'Season the mixture with a pinch of salt and pepper to taste.', 'Sprinkle light muscovado sugar over the brussels sprouts and pancetta, and stir well to coat. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sugar starts to caramelize.', 'Chop the cooked chestnuts into smaller pieces if they are large, and add them to the pan. Stir to combine and allow chestnuts to warm through.', 'Pour in just enough vegetable stock to deglaze the pan, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.', 'Reduce the heat to low and allow the mixture to simmer until the brussels sprouts are tender and the stock has mostly reduced, leaving a sticky glaze, about 10 minutes.', 'Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary, then serve warm as a delicious side dish.']

recipe_name: Creamy Polenta with Pancetta and Onion Infusion
ingredients: ['1 large onion, diced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '100 grams cubetti di pancetta', '1 garlic clove, minced', '2 thyme sprigs, leaves picked', '500 grams ready-cooked polenta, sliced', '50 grams parmesan, grated', '150 ml single or whipping cream', '250 ml chicken or vegetable stock', 'Salt to taste', 'Black pepper to taste']
steps: ['Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.', 'Add the cubetti di pancetta to the skillet with the onions and cook until the pancetta is golden and crisp, about 7-10 minutes.', 'Stir in the minced garlic and thyme leaves to the pancetta and onion mixture, and cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant.', 'In a separate non-stick skillet, lightly oil the surface and place the slices of polenta. Cook the polenta over medium heat for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are warmed through and have a slight golden crust.', 'While the polenta is cooking, pour the chicken or vegetable stock and the single or whipping cream into the skillet with the onion, pancetta, garlic, and thyme. Stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.', 'Add the grated parmesan cheese to the cream mixture, stirring until the cheese has melted and the sauce has thickened slightly. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.', 'To serve, place the warm polenta slices onto plates, and spoon the creamy pancetta and onion sauce over the top. Finish with an extra sprinkle of parmesan cheese if desired.']

recipe_name: Elderflower Cucumber Cooler
ingredients: ['1 cucumber', '1 bottle white wine, chilled', '100 ml elderflower cordial', 'A few mint sprigs', 'Soda water, to top up']
steps: ['Rinse the cucumber and cut it into thin slices.', 'In a large jug, combine the sliced cucumber and elderflower cordial.', 'Bruise the mint sprigs by lightly crushing them in your hand to release the aromatic oils and add them to the jug.', 'Pour the chilled white wine into the jug with the cucumber mixture and elderflower cordial, and mix gently.', 'Top up the jug with soda water according to your taste preference for fizziness.', 'Stir the mixture gently to combine all the flavors.', 'Serve the cooler in glasses over ice, if desired, and garnish with extra mint sprigs and cucumber slices.']

recipe_name: Herb-Infused Roasted Pork Shoulder
ingredients: ['1 pork shoulder joint (around 4-5 pounds)', '4 garlic cloves', '2 teaspoons fennel seed', '1 teaspoon black peppercorns', '1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped', '2 bay leaves', '1 cup dry white wine', 'Salt (as required)', '2 tablespoons olive oil']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C).', 'Crush the garlic cloves and finely chop them.', 'In a mortar and pestle, crush the fennel seeds and black peppercorns together.', 'Mix the crushed garlic, fennel and peppercorn mix, chopped rosemary, and a generous pinch of salt together with olive oil to create a paste.', 'Make several incisions into the pork shoulder joint with a sharp knife.', 'Rub the paste thoroughly all over the pork shoulder joint, making sure to get some into the incisions.', 'Place the bay leaves on the bottom of a roasting pan and set the pork shoulder on top of them.', 'Pour the dry white wine around the pork in the roasting pan.', 'Cover the pan with foil and place it in the preheated oven for approximately 3 hours.', 'After 3 hours, remove the foil and increase the temperature to 400°F (200°C).', 'Roast for another 30-40 minutes, or until the pork skin is crispy and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).', 'Allow the pork shoulder to rest for about 15 minutes before slicing.', 'Serve the roast pork shoulder with the pan juices drizzled over the top.']

recipe_name: Tarragon Chicken with Pancetta and Peas
ingredients: ['Cubetti di pancetta', 'Shallot', 'Olive oil', 'Chicken (breasts or thighs)', 'Chicken stock', 'Peas', 'Tarragon', 'Salt', 'Pepper']
steps: ['Begin by heating some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.', 'Once the oil is hot, add the cubetti di pancetta and cook until it starts to get crispy.', 'Chop the shallot finely and add it to the skillet, cooking until it becomes translucent.', 'Meanwhile, season the chicken with salt and pepper, then add it to the skillet and cook until it is browned on all sides.', 'Once the chicken is browned, pour in enough chicken stock to cover the bottom of the pan, and let it cook for a few minutes to deglaze the pan, scraping up any delicious bits stuck to the bottom.', 'Lower the heat and cover the skillet. Let the chicken cook through, which should take about 15-20 minutes depending on the thickness of the chicken pieces.', 'A few minutes before the chicken is done, add the peas to the skillet and cover again, letting them steam with the chicken and absorb the flavors of the pancetta and shallot.', 'Chop some fresh tarragon and sprinkle it over the chicken and peas to infuse the dish with its distinctive anise-like flavor.', 'Once the chicken is cooked through and the peas are tender, taste the sauce and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.', 'Serve hot directly from the skillet, ensuring that each plate gets an even portion of chicken, pancetta, peas, and the delicious tarragon-infused sauce.']

recipe_name: Triple Chocolate Fantasy Bark
ingredients: ['milk chocolate', 'plain chocolate', 'white chocolate', 'sprinkles', 'sweets']
steps: ['Line a baking sheet with parchment paper to ensure your chocolate bark can be easily removed after it sets.', 'Chop the milk chocolate and plain chocolate into small pieces. Doing so helps them melt uniformly.', 'In separate bowls, melt your milk chocolate, plain chocolate, and white chocolate. This can be done using a microwave in short bursts of 20-30 seconds, stirring in between, or using a double boiler method to avoid scorching the chocolate.', 'Once melted, pour the milk chocolate onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it into an even layer, approximately 1/4 inch thick.', 'Drizzle the plain chocolate over the milk chocolate layer in a random pattern. Use a toothpick or knife to gently swirl the two chocolates together, creating a marbled effect.', 'Before the swirled chocolate sets, carefully spoon melted white chocolate in lines or dollops across the marbled chocolate, then use a clean toothpick or knife to swirl the white chocolate in, adding to the marbled effect.', 'Sprinkle the top of the still-melted chocolate with a generous amount of sprinkles and press in any larger sweets to ensure they stick. You can choose a theme for your sprinkles and sweets, such as a particular color scheme or holiday.', 'Place the baking sheet in the refrigerator and allow the chocolate bark to set completely, which usually takes at least 1 hour.', 'Once the chocolate bark has fully set, remove it from the refrigerator. Break or cut the bark into uneven, rustic pieces.', 'Store your Triple Chocolate Fantasy Bark in an airtight container to prevent it from getting soft or melting. It can be stored at room temperature or in the fridge, depending on the climate.']

recipe_name: Cranberry Redcurrant and White Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Custard
ingredients: ['200g fresh or frozen cranberries', '3 tablespoons redcurrant jelly', '150g golden caster sugar', '200g self-raising flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '3 large eggs', 'Seeds from 1 vanilla pod', '150g butter, softened', '200g fresh vanilla custard', '100g white chocolate']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 180ºC (160ºC fan/gas mark 4) and grease a 20cm round cake tin with a little butter and line the bottom with baking parchment.', 'In a pan over medium heat, combine the cranberries and redcurrant jelly, stirring occasionally until the berries have softened and the mixture has thickened slightly, about 5-7 minutes. Let it cool.', 'Beat together the butter and golden caster sugar until light and fluffy, then gradually beat in the eggs one at a time, adding a little flour with each to prevent the mixture from curdling. Stir in the seeds from the vanilla pod.', 'Sift in the remaining self-raising flour and baking powder, and fold gently into the wet ingredients until just combined.', 'Fold the cooled cranberry and redcurrant mixture through the cake batter to create a marble effect; don’t overmix.', 'Pour the cake batter into the prepared cake tin, smoothing the top with the back of a spoon, and bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.', 'While the cake is baking, chop the white chocolate into small pieces and place it in a small bowl over a pan of simmering water (double boiler), making sure the water doesn’t touch the bottom of the bowl. Stir until melted and smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.', 'Once the cake is done, let it cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.', 'When the cake is completely cool, drizzle the top with the melted white chocolate, letting some drip down the sides for effect.', 'Serve each slice with a dollop of fresh vanilla custard on the side. Enjoy your fruity and indulgent dessert!']

recipe_name: Salmon Duo Salad with Horseradish Cream and Melba Toast
ingredients: ['150g hot-smoked salmon', '2 tsp hot horseradish', '1 lemon', '200g full-fat soft cheese', 'Chives, chopped', '100g smoked salmon', 'Mixed leaves for salad', 'Your favourite dressing', 'Melba toast']
steps: ['Begin by preparing the horseradish cream. In a bowl, mix the full-fat soft cheese with 2 tsp of hot horseradish. Grate the zest of half the lemon and squeeze its juice to taste into the mixture. Stir in chopped chives, a pinch of salt, and a touch of sugar to balance the flavors. Adjust the horseradish to your preference for heat.', 'Arrange mixed salad leaves on plates. Drizzle with your favourite dressing. You could use an oil-based dressing or something creamy to complement the fish.', 'Break the hot-smoked salmon into chunks and scatter it over the salad leaves.', 'Slice the smoked salmon into thin strips and arrange neatly over the salad. The two types of salmon will provide a lovely contrast in both texture and smokiness.', 'Dollop spoonfuls of the horseradish cream over the salad, or serve it on the side for guests to add as they wish.', 'Sprinkle additional chopped chives over the top of the salad for a fresh oniony bite.', 'Serve with crisp Melba toast on the side for added crunch.', 'Finally, cut the remaining lemon into wedges and arrange them around the salad for guests to squeeze over, adding a bright, fresh squeeze of lemon just before eating.']

recipe_name: Spiced Potato & Pea Medley
ingredients: ['potato', 'olive oil', 'mustard seed', 'turmeric', 'garam masala', 'frozen pea', 'salt']
steps: ['Wash and dice the potatoes into small cubes for even cooking.', 'Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.', 'Add 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds to the oil and wait until they begin to sputter.', 'Carefully add the diced potatoes to the skillet, and stir to coat them in the olive oil and mustard seeds.', 'Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder and 1 teaspoon of garam masala over the potatoes. Stir well to distribute the spices evenly.', 'Cover the skillet with a lid and let the potatoes cook, stirring occasionally, until they start to become tender, which should take about 10 minutes.', 'Add 1 cup of frozen peas to the skillet and mix well with the spiced potatoes.', 'Season the mixture with salt to taste. Lower the heat and continue to cook with the lid on until the potatoes are fully cooked and the peas are warm throughout, about another 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Once everything is cooked, give the mixture a final stir and adjust salt if needed.', 'Serve the Spiced Potato & Pea Medley hot as a delightful side dish or a vegetarian main course.']

recipe_name: Rustic Root Vegetable Fritters
ingredients: ['floury potatoes', 'carrots', 'parsnips', 'celeriac', 'plain flour', 'goose fat', 'salt', 'pepper']
steps: ['Peel and grate the floury potatoes, carrots, parsnips, and celeriac into a large mixing bowl. Make sure to squeeze out any excess moisture from the grated vegetables.', 'Season the grated vegetables with salt and pepper, then sprinkle plain flour over them. Mix thoroughly to combine everything together and create a batter-like consistency.', 'Heat a large skillet or non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a generous amount of goose fat to coat the bottom.', 'Once the goose fat is hot, take spoonfuls of the vegetable mixture and carefully place them into the pan, flattening them slightly to form small fritters.', 'Cook the fritters for 3-4 minutes on each side or until they are golden brown and crispy, then carefully flip them using a spatula.', 'Once cooked on both sides, remove the fritters from the pan and drain them on paper towels to remove any excess fat.', 'Serve the rustic root vegetable fritters hot as a side dish or a vegetarian main with a sprinkling of coarse salt on top.']

recipe_name: Ginger-Lime Chicken with Spring Veggie Stir-Fry
ingredients: ['Chicken (cut into strips)', 'Fresh root ginger (minced)', 'Spring onions (sliced)', 'Garlic cloves (minced)', 'Rice noodles', 'Sunflower oil', 'Asparagus (trimmed and cut)', 'Sugar snap peas (trimmed)', 'Green beans (trimmed and cut)', 'Cherry tomatoes (halved)', 'Lime juice', 'Light muscovado sugar', 'Fish sauce', 'Red chillies (sliced, seeds removed for less heat)', 'Basil leaves (torn)', 'Mint leaves (torn)', 'Salted peanuts (crushed)', 'Salt']
steps: ['Step 1: Cook the rice noodles according to the package instructions until they are al dente, then drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process. Set aside.', 'Step 2: In a small bowl, prepare the sauce by combining lime juice, light muscovado sugar, fish sauce, and a pinch of salt. Stir until the sugar has dissolved. Set aside.', 'Step 3: Heat a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat and add sunflower oil. Once hot, add the minced ginger and garlic, and stir-fry for 30 seconds, or until fragrant.', 'Step 4: Increase the heat to high and add the chicken strips to the wok. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.', 'Step 5: Add the asparagus, sugar snap peas, and green beans to the wok with the chicken. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.', 'Step 6: Lower the heat and add the cherry tomatoes and red chillies, cooking for an additional minute.', 'Step 7: Pour the prepared sauce over the chicken and vegetables, and toss to combine everything together. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the dish is heated through.', 'Step 8: Add the cooked rice noodles to the wok and toss until everything is well combined and the noodles are warmed up. If the dish seems too dry, you can add a little more sunflower oil or water.', 'Step 9: Just before serving, stir in the basil and mint leaves, and sprinkle over the crushed salted peanuts for added texture.', 'Step 10: Divide the stir-fry among plates or bowls, garnishing with additional herbs and peanuts if desired. Serve immediately.']

recipe_name: Minty Peas & Beans Frittata with Duo of Cheese
ingredients: ['1 cup frozen peas', '1 cup beans (if canned, drained and rinsed)', '4 eggs', '1/4 cup milk', "1/4 cup goat's cheese, crumbled", '1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled', '2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped', '2 tablespoons oil', 'Salt to taste', 'Pepper to taste']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).', 'In a skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the beans and cook for 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.', 'Add the frozen peas to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes until they are heated through and the beans are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, a pinch of salt, and pepper until well combined.', 'Stir the chopped fresh mint into the egg mixture for a refreshing flavor.', "Pour the egg and mint mixture over the peas and beans in the skillet, making sure it's evenly distributed.", "Sprinkle the crumbled goat's cheese and feta cheese over the top of the egg mixture.", 'Let the frittata cook on the stove for about 4-5 minutes until the edges start to set.', 'Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the frittata is set and the cheese has melted.', 'Once cooked, remove the skillet from the oven (remember to use an oven mitt as the handle will be hot).', 'Serve the frittata warm, garnished with additional fresh mint if desired.']

recipe_name: Clementine Dark Chocolate Trifle
ingredients: ['200g dark chocolate', '3 large eggs', '150g soft light brown sugar', '2 tablespoons cocoa powder', 'Zest of 2 clementines', 'Juice of 2 clementines', '300ml double cream', '2 tablespoons icing sugar', '150g crème fraîche', '100g caster sugar', 'Segments of 2 clementines for decoration', 'Silver balls for decoration', 'White stars for decoration', 'A pinch of salt']
steps: ['Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F, gas mark 4).', 'Melt the dark chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a pot of simmering water. Once melted, remove from the heat and let it cool slightly.', 'In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs with the soft light brown sugar until the mixture is pale and doubles in volume.', 'Gently fold in the cocoa powder and cooled melted dark chocolate to the egg mixture.', 'Pour the mixture into a greased and lined 8-inch square baking tin. Bake for 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out with moist crumbs. Allow the brownie to cool completely then crumble it into small pieces.', 'In a separate bowl, mix the double cream with icing sugar until soft peaks form. Then, fold in the crème fraîche gently.', 'In a small saucepan, combine the caster sugar with clementine juice over medium heat. Let it simmer until the liquid is reduced by half and becomes slightly syrupy. Allow it to cool.', 'Take the clementine zest and fold it into the cream mixture.', 'To assemble the trifle, layer the crumbled brownie at the bottom of a glass dish. Drizzle the clementine syrup over the brownie pieces.', 'Spread a layer of the clementine zest cream mixture over the soaked brownie layer.', 'Repeat the layering process until all components are used up, finishing with a layer of the cream mixture.', 'Decorate the top with clementine segments, silver balls, and white stars. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld together.', 'Serve the trifle chilled, spooned into individual serving bowls or glasses.']

recipe_name: Lemon Butter Parmesan Artichokes
ingredients: ['4 globe artichokes', '2 lemons', '1/4 cup of butter', '1/2 cup of dry white wine', '1/2 cup of grated parmesan', 'Salt to taste', 'Black pepper to taste']
steps: ['Prepare the artichokes by cutting off the stems and trimming the tops of the leaves. Cut them in half and remove the fuzzy choke inside with a spoon.', 'Fill a large bowl with cold water and squeeze the juice of one lemon into it. Place the prepared artichoke halves in the lemon water to prevent browning.', 'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the artichoke halves and simmer for about 15-20 minutes until they are tender when pierced with a knife. Drain them well.', 'In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and then add the dry white wine. Allow the mixture to simmer for 5 minutes, so the alcohol cooks off.', 'Slice the second lemon into thin rounds. Set aside.', 'Preheat your broiler (or oven grill) on high. Arrange the boiled artichoke halves cut-side up on a baking tray.', 'Brush each artichoke half with the lemon butter wine sauce, then sprinkle generously with grated parmesan cheese.', 'Place a lemon round on each artichoke half and season with salt and black pepper.', 'Broil the artichokes for about 5-7 minutes or until the cheese is golden and bubbly, and the edges are slightly charred.', 'Serve immediately, garnished with additional lemon zest if desired.']

recipe_name: Savory Swede & Parsnip Cake
ingredients: ['1 large swede', '3 parsnips', '4 tablespoons butter', '2 tablespoons golden syrup', '1 cup fresh breadcrumbs', '2 eggs', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '4-5 thyme sprigs', 'Salt', 'Pepper']
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).', 'Peel and chop the swede and parsnips into small, even pieces.', 'Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and add the chopped swede and parsnips. Cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes.', 'While the vegetables are cooking, heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of butter and a drizzle of olive oil.', 'Pick the leaves off the thyme sprigs and add them to the skillet, cooking until fragrant.', 'Once the swede and parsnips are done, drain them and mash them in a large bowl with the remaining butter until smooth.', 'Stir in the golden syrup, fresh breadcrumbs, and thyme leaves to the mashed mixture.', 'In a separate bowl, beat the eggs, then fold them into the vegetable mixture until all the ingredients are incorporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Grease a baking dish with olive oil and pour the mixture in, smoothing the top with a spatula.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 35-45 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.', 'Let the savory cake cool for a few minutes before slicing. Can be served warm or at room temperature.']

recipe_name: Cajun Bean Nacho Bowl
ingredients: ['1 large onion, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon soft brown sugar', '2 tablespoons wine vinegar', '2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning', '1 can mixed beans, drained and rinsed', '1 can chopped tomatoes', '1 cup shredded cheddar cheese', '2 cups tortilla chips', '1 ripe avocado, diced', 'Salt to taste']
steps: ['Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until soft and translucent.', 'Stir in the soft brown sugar and cook for another minute until the onion starts to caramelize.', 'Add the wine vinegar and Cajun seasoning. Cook for a couple of minutes until the mixture is fragrant.', 'Pour in the chopped tomatoes and the mixed beans. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt to taste.', 'While the bean mixture is simmering, preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Spread tortilla chips on a baking sheet in an even layer.', 'Spoon the hot bean mixture over the tortilla chips, and sprinkle generously with shredded cheddar cheese.', 'Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 5-7 minutes.', 'Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly. Top with diced avocado right before serving.', 'Serve your Cajun Bean Nacho Bowl warm, as a hearty snack or a casual meal.']

recipe_name: Sparkling Peachy Lemon Rosé Spritz
ingredients: ['1/4 cup caster sugar', '1 tablespoon lemon zest', '1/2 cup lemon juice', '1 bottle rosé wine, chilled', '1/4 cup peach schnapps', '1 large peach, sliced', '1 lemon, sliced', '2 cups ice cubes', 'Soda water, to top up', 'Tonic, optional, to top up']
steps: ['Begin by preparing a simple lemony sugar syrup. Combine the caster sugar, lemon zest, and 1/4 cup of lemon juice in a small saucepan. Heat on a medium flame, stirring until sugar fully dissolves. Allow the mixture to simmer for a few minutes until slightly thickened, then remove from heat and let it cool.', 'In a large pitcher, mix the homemade lemony sugar syrup with the remaining 1/4 cup of lemon juice, chilled rosé wine, and peach schnapps.', 'Add the sliced peaches and lemon to the pitcher, swirl gently to infuse the flavours.', 'When ready to serve, fill glasses with ice cubes.', 'Pour the peachy lemon rosé mixture over the ice, filling the glasses about three-quarters full.', 'Top up each glass with a splash of soda water. If you want a gentle bitterness to balance the sweetness, use tonic instead or do half soda water, half tonic.', 'Gently stir to combine without losing the effervescence.', 'Garnish with a small wheel of lemon or a peach slice on the rim of each glass.', 'Serve the Sparkling Peachy Lemon Rosé Spritz immediately and enjoy a refreshing fruity beverage with a sparkle.']

recipe_name: Disaronno Sparkling Lemonade
ingredients: ['2 oz lemon juice', '1 oz Disaronno', '1 cup ice', '3 oz soda water']
steps: ['In a shaker, combine the lemon juice and Disaronno over ice.', 'Shake well until the mixture is chilled.', 'In a highball glass, fill it with ice.', 'Strain the mixture over the ice in the glass.', 'Top off with soda water.', 'Stir lightly to combine.', 'Serve immediately with a twist of lemon as garnish if desired.']

recipe_name: Pink Grapefruit and Yogurt Brûlée
ingredients: ['1 large pink grapefruit', '2 cups natural yogurt', '1 vanilla pod', '3 tablespoons golden caster sugar', '2 teaspoons clear honey', 'A few mint leaves for garnish', 'A pinch of salt']
steps: ['Preheat your grill to a high setting.', 'Halve the pink grapefruit and use a knife to slightly loosen the grapefruit segments.', 'Place the grapefruit halves on a baking tray, cut side up.', "Drizzle 1 teaspoon of honey over each grapefruit half, ensuring it's spread evenly.", 'Put the grapefruit halves under the grill for about 3-4 minutes or until the tops start to caramelize slightly. Remove from the grill and allow to cool.', 'In the meantime, slice the vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape out the seeds using a knife.', 'Combine the natural yogurt with the vanilla seeds, a pinch of salt, and mix well.', 'Once the grapefruit halves have cooled, spread an even layer of the flavored yogurt over the grapefruit.', 'Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of golden caster sugar evenly over each half of the yogurt-covered grapefruit.', "Using a kitchen torch, carefully caramelize the sugar until golden and bubbly. If you don't have a torch, place the grapefruit halves back under the grill for a minute or so, watching closely to avoid burning.", 'Garnish with fresh mint leaves.', 'Serve immediately, enjoying the warm, caramelized topping with the cool, creamy yogurt and tangy grapefruit.']

recipe_name: Coconut-Peanut Prawn Noodles with Crunchy Veg
ingredients: ['flat rice noodles', 'crunchy peanut butter', 'half-fat coconut milk', 'sweet chilli sauce', 'spring onions', 'cucumber', 'beansprouts', 'cooked peeled prawns', 'salt', 'sugar', 'oil', 'basic spices (optional)']
steps: ['Prepare the noodles according to the package instructions, usually involving soaking in hot water until they are soft. Drain and set aside.', 'In a pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Toss in the spring onions and cook until they are soft and fragrant.', 'Stir in the crunchy peanut butter and half-fat coconut milk to create a smooth sauce. If the sauce is too thick, add a little water to reach the desired consistency.', 'Season the sauce with sweet chilli sauce, salt, and sugar to taste, adding spices if preferred. Warm the mixture until everything is well combined and heated through.', 'Add the cooked peeled prawns to the sauce and toss to coat, cooking until the prawns are heated through.', 'Place the noodles in a serving bowl. Pour the prawn and peanut sauce over the noodles.', 'Top with fresh cucumber slices, beansprouts, and additional spring onions. Serve immediately and enjoy your Coconut-Peanut Prawn Noodles with Crunchy Veg!']

recipe_name: Iberico Ham and Rocket Potato Salad
ingredients: ['new potatoes', 'Iberico ham', 'rocket leaves', 'Dijon mustard', 'white wine vinegar', 'olive oil', 'mayonnaise', 'snipped chives', 'salt', 'pepper']
steps: ['Start by thoroughly washing your new potatoes and then boiling them in salted water until just fork-tender. Allow the potatoes to cool slightly before cutting them into halves or quarters, depending on their size.', 'In a small bowl, whisk together two tablespoons of olive oil, one tablespoon of white wine vinegar, a teaspoon of Dijon mustard, and a tablespoon of mayonnaise to create a tangy dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and then stir in the snipped chives.', 'In a large mixing bowl, combine the cut and slightly cooled potatoes with the dressing, gently tossing to make sure each potato is well coated.', 'Take a handful of rocket leaves and toss them in with the potatoes. The warmth from the potatoes will slightly wilt the rocket, which enhances the flavor.', 'Take the Iberico ham and tear it into bite-sized pieces. Iberico has a strong flavor, so use it sparingly to balance the dish.', 'Add the Iberico ham to the potato and rocket mixture and give it a final delicate toss to combine all the flavors.', 'Adjust the seasoning if necessary, and add an extra drizzle of olive oil if the salad seems too dry.', "Plate the salad and serve it as a refreshing appetizer or a light meal. The combination of creamy potatoes, peppery rocket, and rich Iberico ham creates a symphony of flavors that's sure to please. Enjoy!"]

recipe_name: Honey-Mustard Lamb’s Lettuce Salad with Halloumi and Crunchy Fruits
ingredients: ['2 limes, juice and zest', '2 tbsp wholegrain mustard', '3 tbsp honey', '2 eating apples, cored and sliced', '2 pears, cored and sliced', '1/4 cup olive oil', '250g halloumi cheese, sliced', '4 radishes, thinly sliced', '2 carrots, peeled and shredded', '1/2 cup pecans, roughly chopped', "4 cups lamb's lettuce, washed and dried", 'Salt, to taste', 'Pepper, to taste']
steps: ['In a small bowl, whisk together the juice and zest of 2 limes, wholegrain mustard, honey, and olive oil until it forms a smooth dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Preheat a grill or griddle pan on medium heat. Brush slices of halloumi cheese with a little olive oil and grill for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until they are golden and have grill marks. Remove and set aside.', "In another bowl, combine the lamb's lettuce, sliced radishes, and shredded carrots. Toss gently to mix.", 'Add the sliced apples and pears to the salad bowl. Drizzle half of the dressing over the salad and toss to coat the ingredients well.', 'Arrange the grilled halloumi slices on top of the salad. Sprinkle the chopped pecans over the cheese and salad.', 'Drizzle the remaining honey-mustard dressing over the halloumi and salad.', 'Serve the Honey-Mustard Lamb’s Lettuce Salad with Halloumi and Crunchy Fruits immediately, ensuring that each plate gets a portion of the halloumi, pecans, and dressing.']

recipe_name: Red Wine and Redcurrant Turkey Gravy
ingredients: ['3 tablespoons red wine', '2 tablespoons cornflour', '2 cups turkey or chicken stock', '1/4 cup redcurrant jelly', 'Pan juices from roasted turkey', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
steps: ['Pour the pan juices from the roasted turkey into a large measuring cup or gravy separator. Allow the fat to rise to the top and skim it off.', 'Place the roasting pan over a burner on medium heat and add the red wine. Scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen any flavorful bits.', 'Strain the pan juices and add enough turkey or chicken stock to make up 2 cups of liquid. Add the liquid to the roasting pan.', 'In a small bowl, mix the cornflour with 3 tablespoons of cold water to create a slurry.', 'Gradually whisk the cornflour slurry into the pan. Stir constantly until the gravy starts to thicken.', 'Add the redcurrant jelly and stir until it is completely dissolved into the gravy.', 'Season the gravy with salt and pepper. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.', 'Simmer for a few minutes until the gravy reaches your preferred consistency. Remember that the gravy will continue to thicken as it cools.', 'Serve the gravy hot alongside your roasted turkey or chicken.']

recipe_name: Smoked Trout and Celeriac Salad with Lemon-Caper Dressing
ingredients: ['1 medium celeriac, peeled and julienned', '200g smoked trout, flaked', '100g rocket leaves', '3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons capers, roughly chopped', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '50g cornichons, sliced', 'Handful of parsley leaves, chopped', 'Salt to taste', 'Black pepper to taste']
steps: ['Using a vegetable peeler, remove the outer skin from the celeriac and then julienne the flesh into thin matchsticks. Place in a large salad bowl.', 'Flake the smoked trout into bite-sized pieces, being careful to remove any bones, and add to the bowl with the celeriac.', 'Wash the rocket leaves and pat them dry. Tear any large leaves to ensure that all pieces are bite-sized. Add the rocket to the bowl with the trout and celeriac.', 'In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the extra-virgin olive oil, mayonnaise, and lemon juice until well combined. This will be your dressing.', 'Stir in the chopped capers and sliced cornichons into the dressing.', 'Season the dressing with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Always start with a small amount and adjust as needed after tasting.', 'Pour the lemon-caper dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat all the ingredients evenly.', 'Lastly, sprinkle the chopped parsley leaves over the salad and give it one final gentle toss.', 'Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. The salad should have a nice balance of tartness from the lemon juice and capers, creaminess from the mayonnaise, and a fresh kick from the parsley and rocket.', 'Serve immediately as a light, refreshing main or as a side dish to a larger meal.']

recipe_name: Rustic Apple and Blackberry Tart
ingredients: ['2 cups plain flour', '1 pinch salt', '1/2 cup butter, chilled and diced', '1/4 cup caster sugar', '1 tsp lemon zest', '1 egg yolk', '2 tbsp milk', '2 cooking apples, peeled, cored and sliced', '1 cup blackberries', '2 tbsp caster sugar for sprinkling']
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius (400 degrees Fahrenheit).', 'In a large bowl, mix the plain flour and salt together.', 'Add the diced butter to the flour mixture and combine with your fingertips until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.', 'Stir in the 1/4 cup of caster sugar and lemon zest.', 'Add the egg yolk and milk to the flour mixture. Mix until the dough starts to come together, then knead briefly to form a smooth dough.', 'On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a rough circle about 12 inches in diameter.', 'Transfer the rolled-out dough to a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper.', 'Arrange the sliced apples and blackberries in the center of the dough, leaving about a 2-inch border all around.', 'Fold the edges of the dough over the fruit, overlapping slightly and pressing gently to seal the edges.', 'Sprinkle the 2 tablespoons of caster sugar over the fruit and the dough edges.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for about 40-45 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the fruit is bubbling.', 'Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before slicing.', 'Serve warm or at room temperature as a rustic dessert.']

recipe_name: Creamy Bay Leaf Infused Potato Puree
ingredients: ['salted butter', 'small salad potatoes', 'bay leaves', 'full-fat milk', 'salt (to taste)', 'black pepper (to taste)']
steps: ['Begin by thoroughly washing your small salad potatoes to remove any dirt. No need to peel them for this recipe, as the skin will add a nice texture.', 'Place the potatoes in a large pot and fill it with enough water to cover them. Add a generous pinch of salt and two bay leaves to the water for extra flavor.', 'Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer, cooking the potatoes until they are fork-tender, usually about 15-20 minutes.', 'Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them and discard the bay leaves.', 'In a small pot, gently heat the full-fat milk with a bay leaf until it is warm, but not boiling, to infuse it with bay leaf flavor. Take care not to let it boil over.', 'Mash the potatoes using a potato masher or pass them through a potato ricer for a smoother texture.', 'Fold in the warm, bay-infused milk a little at a time into the mashed potatoes, stirring continuously. The amount of milk you add will depend on how creamy you like your puree.', 'Add in the salted butter to the mixture and stir until the butter is fully melted and incorporated into the potato puree.', 'Season the potato puree with salt and freshly ground black pepper according to your taste. Remove any bay leaves if you come across any while mixing.', 'Serve the creamy bay leaf infused potato puree hot, either as a delicious side dish or a comforting main course on its own.']

recipe_name: Smoked Mackerel and Beetroot Salad with Horseradish Dressing
ingredients: ['baby salad leaves', 'smoked mackerel fillets', 'horseradish cream', 'shallots', 'red wine vinegar', 'cooked, peeled beetroot', 'olive oil', 'salt', 'sugar']
steps: ['Begin by preparing the dressing. In a small bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons of horseradish cream, 1 tablespoon of red wine vinegar, 3 tablespoons of olive oil, a pinch of sugar and salt to taste. Whisk them together until well combined.', 'Slice the shallots thinly and add them to the dressing you just prepared, allowing them to marinate and soften slightly.', 'Wash and pat dry the baby salad leaves, then arrange them as a base on a large serving platter.', 'Take the smoked mackerel fillets and break them into bite-sized pieces carefully with your fingers to maintain some texture and arrange them over the baby salad leaves.', 'Cut the cooked, peeled beetroot into bite-sized wedges or slices and scatter them throughout the salad, providing a vibrant contrast.', 'Finally, drizzle the horseradish dressing over the salad, ensuring you include the marinated shallot slices.', 'Gently toss the salad, so that the leaves get coated with the dressing, but do so with care to not break the mackerel fillets.', 'Serve immediately, allowing diners to experience the combination of fresh greens, briny mackerel, earthy beets, and spicy horseradish. The beetroot and mackerel salad is a beautiful dance of flavors and textures suitable for a starter or a light meal.']
